name: Gauging interest in a Shifter Guide
author: Pope

posts.author: Skeleton Pope
posts.content:
Greetings ECBer's,

I've been somewhat of a lurker for a long time but do to long days at the office and a recent renewed interest in the game I figured I would start interacting more with you fine folks.

I'm currently thinking about putting my notes and knowledge on shifter builds into a small guide as I've noticed quite a few people lamenting the lack of one. I don't think I could make something on the level of Max's or Mick daggers but I'm happy to share what I know. The focus on the guide will be more on styles of shifter builds, how they are played, what environment to play which shifter build in and the various quirks and oddities of merging. We already have excellent resources for what shifter forms do and how they do it, im more interested in the application of said tools.

I've been playing NWN off and on for 15 years and the majority of my characters have been shifters of various types. I recently have been enjoying swordflight and I am a rabid fan of WoG alongside many others. I have successfully finished Aielund saga, OC, OC extension modules, Blackguard, and many others all with shifters. I even did some extensive pvp with them on a few arena servers for a few months. I currently have 1 level 40 Shifter/druid/monk, 1 level 35 shifter/druid/barbarian, and a low 20's shifter/druid/assasin on world of greyhawk that I have leveled with a combination of soloing and duoing. Plus a few characters lost to time on the 1.69 version of the server.

I'm making this post as a general introduction and invitation to anyone with questions or insight into the shifter class or its various builds to join in.

Once the full guide is typed I will be submitting it for approval and critique in the appropriate forum.

Zelles guide is more a repository of shifter form stats than a true guide imo.

Very useful for builders and absolute newbies in understanding the forms, but doesn't provide much in the way of applying said forms to builds, and playing them in modules/pws

Yes, Zelles has a lot of info for forms.

HipMaestro, who revisited it, has a lot of Shifter builds, including Lord of Terror (one of my Favs - I have one for WoG) which contains a lot of info!

Mick Dagger has his very good Kobold Commando (which I changed to do the Epic Kobold Commando for fun stuff on WoG).

But if you wish to do a guide, a full guide...I'm all for it.
